revised_title: Anniversary Address: Scientific Achievements and Honors in 1948
tldr: In this address, Sir Robert Robinson highlights the significant scientific achievements and honors awarded in 1948. He discusses the contributions of Archibald Vivian Hill in biophysics, Franz Eugen Simon in low-temperature physics, Harold Jeffreys in theoretical geomechanics, James Gray in animal locomotion, and Edmund Langley Hirst in carbohydrate chemistry. The address also mentions the awards and medals given to these scientists by the Royal Society.
